subsections.title: Identify External and Internal Issues
questions: Which internal factors (structure, culture, technologies, resources) influence the EMS?
Which external factors (laws, market, societal expectations) affect the EMS?
How is climate change considered as an external factor (risks + opportunities)?
Are these issues regularly monitored and updated (e.g., SWOT, risk analysis)?
Are all climate-relevant processes considered (e.g., raw materials, supply chain)?
Which regional disposal infrastructures influence the EMS?

subsections.title: Risk-based Approach in Climate Context
questions: How are impacts of climate change integrated into environmental and climate strategy?
Are there processes for deriving actions from opportunities and risks?
Are these factors documented and regularly reviewed?
How do climate factors flow into strategic decisions?

subsections.title: Expectations of Interested Parties (Stakeholders)
questions: Which internal and external stakeholders are relevant?
What environmental and climate requirements do they have?
How are climate protection requirements (e.g., SBT, CSRD) captured and prioritized?
Are there routines for identifying changed requirements (surveys, assessments)?

subsections.title: Scope of the Management System
questions: Which locations, activities, products are included in the EMS?
Are all climate-relevant processes included?
Are exclusions justified and documented?
Is the scope communicated internally and externally?

subsections.title: Interfaces to Other Management Systems
questions: How is overlap with ISO 9001/50001 etc. handled?
Are exceptions transparently justified?

subsections.title: Management System and Processes
questions: Does a process landscape exist including environmental and climate-relevant processes?
Who are the process owners?
Are there KPIs for ecological aspects (CO₂, waste, energy)?
Are interfaces between processes identified and optimized?

subsections.title: Responsibility and Commitment of Management
questions: How does top management demonstrate support for EMS and climate protection?
Are there adopted climate and environmental objectives?

subsections.title: Environmental Policy
questions: Does the environmental policy contain statements on climate protection and emission reduction?
Is it linked to the strategic direction?
Does it contain commitment to continuous improvement and compliance with requirements?
Is it regularly updated?
Does it contain commitments to waste prevention, recycling, sustainable procurement?
Does management actively support climate protection projects?

subsections.title: Roles, Responsibilities and Authorities
questions: Are environmental roles clearly defined?
Do responsible parties have authority to implement climate protection measures?
Are there backup arrangements?

subsections.title: Participation and Consultation of Workers
questions: How are employees involved (training, workshops, idea management)?
What communication channels exist?
Are there feedback opportunities?
How is information about environmental topics communicated?

subsections.title: Actions to Address Risks and Opportunities
questions: Are environmental and climate risks identified and assessed?
How are opportunities utilized (funding programs, green markets)?
Is there prioritization of actions?
Are there responsibilities and timeframes?

subsections.title: Legal and Other Requirements
questions: Does a legal register exist for environment/climate?
How are legal changes identified and implemented?
Are there voluntary climate targets (SBT, Net-Zero)?
Are commitments documented and tracked?

subsections.title: Environmental Objectives and Planning
questions: Are objectives formulated SMART?
Which KPIs are used (CO₂, energy, waste)?
Are actions, resources, responsible parties defined?
Is progress reported?
Are there concrete emission reduction and waste targets?

subsections.title: Emergency and Crisis Planning
questions: Are there scenarios for climate-related events (heat, flood, supply chains)?
Are there preventive measures (flood protection, emergency power)?
Are there plans for personnel absences or environmentally critical processes?

subsections.title: Determination of Environmental Aspects
questions: Are all processes assessed regarding environmental impact?
Is the life cycle approach considered?
Are there criteria/methods for assessing significance?
Are emission and resource aspects captured?
Are development projects involved in a timely manner?
Is the list regularly updated?
Are significant aspects integrated into objectives?
Are there action plans to reduce impacts?

subsections.title: Hazardous Materials Management
questions: Is there a hazardous materials register?
Is there CLP/GHS classification?
How are environmental impacts assessed?
Is the life cycle of hazardous materials considered?
Are exposure pathways assessed?
Are REACH/CLP requirements met?
Are changes monitored and implemented?

subsections.title: Resource Management & Infrastructure
questions: Are sufficient resources available for environment/climate protection?
How are measuring devices and tools maintained?
Are there preventive maintenance plans?
Are waste management resources provided?

subsections.title: Competence and Qualification
questions: Are there training courses on environmental law, climate protection, waste, hazardous materials?
Are there needs analyses?
How is the qualification of external employees ensured?
Are there officers for hazardous materials management?

subsections.title: Knowledge Preservation
questions: How is knowledge secured (handovers, documentation)?
How are SDS and internal guidelines managed?
How are updates maintained?

subsections.title: Documented Information
questions: How are EMS documents controlled and versioned?
Are there guidelines for confidential data?
Are there authorization systems?

subsections.title: Awareness and Communication
questions: Which channels are used (newsletter, intranet, notices)?
Are there environmental campaigns?

subsections.title: Communication & Documentation
questions: How are updates communicated?
Are labels checked?
Is there a communication matrix?

subsections.title: Operational Planning and Control
questions: Are processes controlled to minimize environmental impacts?
Are CO₂, water, waste regularly monitored?
Are there SOPs for hazardous materials?
Are inspections conducted?
How is compliance with disposal companies ensured?
Are there control mechanisms in procurement?
Are hazardous materials correctly labeled and stored?

subsections.title: Management of Change
questions: How are changes assessed for environmental impact?
Are there approval processes?

subsections.title: Procurement and Supplier Management
questions: Are ecological criteria considered?
Are there supplier assessments?
Are ethical aspects considered?

subsections.title: Operational Control & Process Organization
questions: Are eco-design principles applied?
Are supply chains optimized for climate friendliness?
Are there emergency plans for environmental events?

subsections.title: Maintenance Management
questions: Is there preventive maintenance?
How are intervals managed?

subsections.title: Emergency & Environmental Protection
questions: Are service providers checked for environmental standards?
Are there reporting channels for violations?
Are there emergency plans for hazardous material incidents?
Are drills conducted?

subsections.title: Disposal / Waste Management
questions: Are all waste streams captured?
Are there separation systems?
Are there recycling targets?
Is disposal properly documented?
How are hazardous wastes separated and disposed of?
Are legal requirements met?
Are there waste metrics?

subsections.title: Monitoring and Measurement
questions: Which environmental metrics are collected and analyzed?
Are hazardous material data monitored?
How are deviations documented?
Are there regular reports?

subsections.title: Internal Audits
questions: Are all environmentally relevant processes in the audit plan?
Are hazardous material and waste topics audited?
Are unannounced audits conducted?
How is auditor competence ensured?
How are audit results prioritized?

subsections.title: Management Review
questions: How often does management review take place?
How are results documented and used?
Do environmental and emission data flow in?
How are new objectives derived?

subsections.title: Feedback & Learning
questions: Are there lessons learned?
Is stakeholder feedback considered?

subsections.title: Continuous Improvement
questions: Are there programs or workshops for resource conservation?
Are best practices shared?
Are there clear procedures for error cases?

subsections.title: Non-conformities & Corrective Actions
questions: Are there processes for reporting and processing environmental violations?
Are root cause analyses conducted?
Are measures checked for effectiveness?
Are repeat cases prevented?

subsections.title: Substitution Management
questions: Are hazardous substances checked for replacement?
Is there a structured approach for substitution?

subsections.title: Innovation Management
questions: Are climate-friendly innovations promoted?
Are employees encouraged to submit ideas?

subsections.title: Compliance & Ethics
questions: How are compliance requirements met?
How are business partners audited for environmental compliance?
